Key Match Events: Ross Adair scored a century off 58 balls
Ireland beat South Africa by 10 runs
Paul Stirling won the Player of the Series
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland will hope that their bowling attack can really up their game
South Africa has looked a much better side after the poor show in the UAE against Afghanistan earlier
Aiden Markram will hope that the Proteas can once again step up their performances as they aim to secure their second win and confirm a clean-sweep series victory
The Irish side will be under pressure to step up after their loss in the previous game
With less dew on the pitch, Ireland managed to pull through and secure the win
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling, the winning captain, is delighted with the victory, acknowledging that it could have gone either way
Ross Adair wins the Player of the Match award for his outstanding knock of a century off 58 balls
Aiden Markram, the captain of South Africa, starts by saying that there were small moments with both bat and ball, which they missed on
Both the skipper's come together and lift the trophy as this T20I series ends in a draw
Miscellaneous Highlights: No rain expected, temperature at 30 degrees Celsius
Ireland's bowlers and fielders held their nerve in the closing stages, executing perfect death bowling and sharp fielding to stifle any late resurgence
South Africa's chase of 196 was always going to be a formidable task, but they began with confidence, thanks to Reeza Hendricks and Ryan Rickelton, who provided a solid platform
